entry.title: The Uselessness of Useful Knowledge
entry.content: Today’s powerful but little-understood artificial intelligence breakthroughs echo past examples of unexpected scientific progress.

entry.title: A Hint of Dark Matter Sends Physicists Looking to the Skies
entry.content: After a search of neutron stars finds preliminary evidence for hypothetical dark matter particles called axions, astrophysicists are devising new ways to spot them.

entry.title: The Astronomer Who’s About to See the Skies of Other Earths
entry.content: After the ultra-powerful James Webb Space Telescope launches later this year, Laura Kreidberg will lead two efforts to check the weather on rocky planets orbiting other stars.

entry.title: Work on Earth’s Climate and Other Complex Systems Earns Nobel Prize in Physics
entry.content: Syukuro Manabe and Klaus Hasselmann have been honored for their work that led to reliable predictions of the effects of climate change. They will share the Nobel with Giorgio Parisi, who has made pioneering studies of chaotic physical systems.
